title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
10:19 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <+sburjan> yepp .. I pointed it out to him :P  
10:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <+sburjan> doesn anyone have any idea why don't we have a button to exit "Print Preview" mode ? IMO we should add a button  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> http://www.ucdetector.org/  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> That thing looks like it could be fun  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> Maybe even worth installing eclipse for  
10:48 <+sburjan> yes, but if code is used in another project, how can the plugin detect it ?  
10:51 <@cjdelisle> It can't but we can deprecate the unused code and then 2 releases remove it and let other projects adapt.  
10:51 <+sburjan> but looks nice in smaller projects (where all code is in the same project)  
10:53 <@cjdelisle> There is code in xwiki-core which is understood to be internal and if people are using it externally, they do so at their risk.  
11:01 <@cjdelisle> Hmm it has an ant job. I could probably rig it up to make reports using the reporting tool I wrote.  
11:01 <vmassol1> cjdelisle: are you sure findbugs doesn't report that?  
11:02 <vmassol1> btw intellij does that for me on the fly  
11:03 <vmassol1> the problem is that you're never sure  
11:03 <@cjdelisle> yea yea yea proprietary :P  
11:04 <vmassol1> I mean you can never be sure a method is not called  
11:04 <@cjdelisle> You mean because it might be reflected?  
11:04 <vmassol1> it's not  
11:04 <vmassol1> proprietary  
11:04 <vmassol1> it's open source  
11:05 <vmassol1> (the community edition at least)  
11:05 <@cjdelisle> Oh, I thought you needed some magic license number or something.  
11:05 <vmassol1> they open source the community edition 2 or3 years ago  
11:06 <vmassol1> http://blogs.jetbrains.com/idea/2009/10/intellij-idea-open-sourced/  
11:06 <+sburjan> I hear only good things about IntelliJ  
11:07 <@cjdelisle> I don't use ides because they're proprietary or slow, I just don't like all of those buttons, giant ui for me to try to learn when I already know the console.  
11:07 <@cjdelisle> \*I don't not use...  
11:07 <vmassol1> real coders code in assembly language! yeah :)  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> Well... When a program is eating up processor time, taking apart a tight loop might be the best thing to do.  
11:08 <vmassol1> yes they're slow but they bring lots of advantages  
11:08 <vmassol1> anyway not starting a flamewar…. got to figure out why the blog app broken  
11:09 <vmassol1> almost there  
11:09 <@cjdelisle> Cool. I was thinking if we could get reports on unused code then we could deprecate smarter.  
11:21 <vmassol1> question: is it better to throw  NPE or to display the current date when xwiki.formatDate is called with a null date?  
11:22 <vmassol1> (NPE or another exception for that matter - I'm talking about the velocity API of XWiki not the java one)  
11:23 <vmassol1> in the case at hand it would mean all blog entries are displayed with the current date instead of the date the netry has been posted  
11:23 <vmassol1> of course the best answer for that use case is to have the extension manager detect an incompatibility of version and report it properly but still it's possible for a script to call formatDate with null  
11:24 <+sburjan> vmassol1: WDYM blog is broken ? seems working on latest trunk  
11:24 <vmassol1> sburjan: I've posted a mail  
11:24 <vmassol1> 1.26 doesn't work with 3.0M1  
11:24 <vmassol1> 1.27 works  
11:24 <vmassol1> it's "normal"  
11:25 <vmassol1> but still breaks all blogs on myxwiki.org for example  
11:25 <+sburjan> well I don't know which version my build uses :P  
11:25 <+sburjan> oh, I see  
11:25 <+sburjan> so it's the migration issue  
11:34 <jstoldt> hmmm there is still no date for XE 2.7.1...  
11:34 <+sburjan> I think I found a bug. I set the default language to RO, enable multilingual and add ro, fr. i save, and my wiki is in english language. WDYT ?  
11:34 <+sburjan> if I disable multilingual and default is to RO, it works  
11:38 <+sburjan> setting to FR same .. english wiki .. I'm gonna report this  
11:45 <mflorea> has quit  
11:48 <+sburjan> vmassol1: with the new rule on JIRA, if I have a issue on trunk, when reporting to JIRA I have to put affects M2, right ?  
11:48 <+sburjan> also backwards where applicable  
11:49 <vmassol1> if the problem happens on 3.0M2-SNAPSHOT yes you need to put 3.0M2  
11:50 <+sburjan> well I'm testing today's build, which is 3.0-SNAPSHOT.34407  
11:50 <+sburjan> this is between M1 and M2  
11:50 <+sburjan> I'll put affects M1 or both ?  
11:51 <vmassol1> if it's presnet in M1 then affects is definitely m1  
11:51 <vmassol1> that's important to set right  
11:51 <vmassol1> you \*\*only\*\* put M2 if it \*\*doesn't\*\* affect M1  
11:51 <+sburjan> stored  
11:52 <+sburjan> XWIKI-5953  
12:25 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:06 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
13:11 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <lucaa> has quit  
13:22 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <+sburjan> I think I found another bug. I create a space. I go to Admin Space. It seems the WebPreferences page is created. That page seems to be orphan. is it normal ? (I see it's orphan by adding the Orphan pages panel) .. note that \_only\_ spaces added by user and admin have this behaviour. The spaces that come with default build don't. Any idea if it's a bug ?  
13:41 <+sburjan> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/Test+Space/WebPreferences?editor=wiki doesn't list any Parent, and for example WebPreferences from Invitation Space has  has parent: Invitation.WebHome  
13:42 <vmassol1> sburjan: yes you can created a jira for this, as an improvement  
13:42 <vmassol1> (it's a bit harsh to consider it a bug)  
13:42 <+sburjan> well .. it's a bit bad to have orphan pages  
13:42 <vmassol1> s/created/create/  
13:42 <vmassol1> sure  
13:42 <+sburjan> ok, I'll make an improvement  
13:43 <vmassol1> (it's allowed though)  
13:43 <+sburjan> yes, but you can get confused if you don't see your page in Tree list for example  
13:44 <+sburjan> in which xwiki core component this should be reported ?  
13:44 <@cjdelisle> ucdetectoring /core/trunk/...   my poor disk is like "why me?"  
13:45 <+sburjan> Templates and User Interface ?  
13:45 <@cjdelisle> I think you want to make that in the "user interface" section.  
13:45 <+sburjan> thanks  
13:51 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5955  
14:02 <+sburjan> vmassol1: when I modify something in the Search page from Administer Wiki, a new page called SearchConfig is created ?  
14:03 <@cjdelisle> That's normal  
14:03 <+sburjan> is it normal also to be orphan ?  
14:04 <@cjdelisle> heh, I suppose it should not but it is not critical.  
14:04 <+sburjan> I know. but it's gonna be reported anyway as an improvement  
14:06 <+sburjan> XWIKI-5956

16:21 <+sburjan> can anybody running one of the latest snapshotc confirm that enabling accessibility features : doesn't do \_anything\_ (not working) ?  
16:43 <jstoldt> bye. have a nice weekend, everybody  
16:43 <jstoldt> has quit  
16:44 <vmassol> bye  
16:44 <vmassol> too late

18:17 <abusenius> has quit  
18:31 <evalica> has quit  
18:36 <@cjdelisle> What is the status of com.xpn.xwiki.store.jcr.\*?  
18:37 <vmassol> unused for sure  
18:37 <vmassol> I'd also say unfinished  
18:37 <@cjdelisle> So a proposal to deprecate woule be warmly received?  
18:37 <vmassol> could be moved to retired probably  
18:37 <vmassol> deprecate isn't needed  
18:37 <vmassol> since it's never been used/ready  
18:38 <@cjdelisle> I see. Removing that would improve our clover reports significantly I think.  
18:38 <@cjdelisle> clover is the test coverage one right?  
18:41 <vmassol> yes
